gbvision.net package¶

Submodules¶

gbvision.net.async_tcp_stream_receiver module¶

gbvision.net.async_udp_stream_receiver module¶

gbvision.net.stream_broadcaster module¶

class gbvision.net.stream_broadcaster.StreamBroadcaster(shape=(0, 0), fx: float = 1.0, fy: float = 1.0, use_grayscale: bool = False, max_fps: int = None)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

this is an abstract broadcaster that sends stream to a broadcast receiver this class should not be instanced but inherited from creates a new stream broadcaster with all parameters that are used in every broadcaster

Parameters

  • shape – optional, the shape (x, y) of the sent frame, when set to something other then (0, 0) it overrides the fx and fy parameters, when set to (0, 0) it is not used

  • fx – ratio between width of the given frame to the width of the frame sent, default is 1 (same width)

  • fy – ratio between height of the given frame to the height of the frame sent, default is 1 (same height)

  • use_grayscale – boolean indicating if the frame should be converted to grayscale when sent, default is False

  • max_fps – integer representing the maximum fps (frames per second) of the stream, when set to None there is no fps limitation, default is None

abstract send_frame(frame)¶

sends the given frame to the stream receiver :param frame: the frame to send

gbvision.net.stream_receiver module¶

class gbvision.net.stream_receiver.StreamReceiver(shape=(0, 0), fx: float = 1.0, fy: float = 1.0)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

this is an abstract receiver that receives stream from a broadcast receiver this class should not be instanced but inherited from

Parameters

  • shape – optional, the shape (x, y) of the sent frame, when set to something other then (0, 0) it overrides the fx and fy parameters, when set to (0, 0) it is not used

  • fx – ratio between width of the read frame to the width of the frame returned, default is 1 (same width)

  • fy – ratio between height of the read frame to the height of the frame returned, default is 1 (same height)

abstract get_frame() → numpy.ndarray¶

reads a frame from the stream and returns in

Returns

the frame read as a numpy array

gbvision.net.tcp_stream_broadcaster module¶

class gbvision.net.tcp_stream_broadcaster.TCPStreamBroadcaster(port: int, shape=(0, 0), fx=1.0, fy=1.0, im_encode='.jpg', use_grayscale=False, max_fps: int = None)¶

Bases: gbvision.net.stream_broadcaster.StreamBroadcaster

this class uses TCP to send a stream over the network, the stream is by default set to be MJPEG the broadcaster is the server and the receiver is the client

Parameters

  • port – the port which TCP will be using

  • im_encode – the type of image encoding to send over the network, default is .jpg (JPEG) for missing parameters, see documentation on StreamBroadcaster

send_frame(frame)¶

sends the given frame to the stream receiver :param frame: the frame to send

gbvision.net.tcp_stream_receiver module¶

class gbvision.net.tcp_stream_receiver.TCPStreamReceiver(ip: str, port: int, shape=(0, 0), fx: float = 1.0, fy: float = 1.0)¶

Bases: gbvision.net.stream_receiver.StreamReceiver

this class uses TCP to receive a stream over the network, the stream is by default set to be MJPEG the broadcaster is the server and the receiver is the client

Parameters

  • ip – the IPv4 address of the stream broadcaster, for example ‘10.45.90.8’

  • port – the port which TCP should use

get_frame()¶

reads a frame from the stream and returns in

Returns

the frame read as a numpy array

gbvision.net.udp_stream_broadcaster module¶

class gbvision.net.udp_stream_broadcaster.UDPStreamBroadcaster(ip: str, port: int, shape=(0, 0), fx: float = 1.0, fy: float = 1.0, im_encode: str = '.jpg', use_grayscale: bool = False, max_fps: int = None)¶

Bases: gbvision.net.stream_broadcaster.StreamBroadcaster

this class uses UDP to send a stream over the network, the stream is by default set to be MJPEG the broadcaster is the client and the receiver is the server WARNING: do not use this class to send large images, udp has a limited packet size

Parameters

  • ip – the IPv4 address of the udp stream receiver, for example ‘10.45.90.5’

  • port – the port that UDP uses to send packets on

  • im_encode – the type of image encoding to send over the network, default is ‘.jpg’ (JPEG)

send_frame(frame)¶

sends the given frame to the stream receiver :param frame: the frame to send

gbvision.net.udp_stream_receiver module¶

Bases: gbvision.net.stream_receiver.StreamReceiver

this class uses UDP to receive a stream over the network, the stream is by default set to be MJPEG the broadcaster is the client and the receiver is the server WARNING: do not use this class to send large images, udp has a limited packet size

Parameters

port – the port which udp should use
